alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 6:58PM EDT until August 12 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Ulster County in east central New York... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 657 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Napanoch, or near Ellenville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... New Paltz, Ellenville, Modena, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Napanoch, Wawarsing, Lloyd, Gardiner, Cherrytown, Tuckers Corner, Forest Glen, Liebhardt, Fantinekill, Elting Corners, Ireland Corners, Mombaccus, Honk Hill, Greenfield Park and Lackawack. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
